text: the following report contains some
graphic images it's a choice no mother
should ever have to make deciding which
of her sons might live or die
both were suffering from kidney failure
but only one of them could receive their
mother's organ I don't know why both my
sons are ill she says but in the end the
decision was taken for her death even
beating dilation I decided my brother
should get the kidney he's still young
and has a better chance of a recovery
everyone has the urge to live I hope
I'll get a kidney soon
China has a huge organ shortage the ones
harvested the organs of executed
prisoners now Beijing says it will only
accept public donations but the Chinese
believe the body should be buried and
tacked and with less than one donation
per million people its donor rates are
among the lowest in the world the
patients at this hospital can count
ourselves lucky there are among the rare
few in China to receive a life-saving
transplant for everyone here there are
thousands of others waiting for an organ
and that huge demand has created a
thriving black market and these are the
scars of the trade deeply in debt this
21 year old says he sold his kidney for
four thousand pounds he doesn't want his
identity revealed but he describes the
dark secretive world where the
traffickers operate any young child on
additional petrodollar uses I was
blindfolded and driven to a small
farmhouse inside there was a full
surgical theater the woman receiving my
kidney was also there I was scared but
the doctors put me to sleep I woke up
and
kidney was gone the buyer wanted life
and I wanted money in the usual way
machine usual way to mean
lehigh Chen also wants life but will
only accept illegally obtained kidney
for now he gets dialysis three times a
week but like many others here he fears
he'll die before ever getting a
transplant
